result.execSummary:
The defendant Glenn B. Wiley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Glenn B. Wiley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Glenn B. Wiley was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment (full time) and follow-through with recommended treatment.   Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:24pm-  Attorney Hertz-McGrath withdraws previous motion to withdraw.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:09am-  Attorney Hertz-McGrath has filed a motion to withdraw & asks that her motion be held in abeyance until 12/5/2014.  Matters remains on the court's calendar for 12/9/2014 at 2pm.  Bond continued.
of mailing from Atty Hertz-McGrath
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record - filed by Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath   (11/24/2014 at 9:30am)
Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Hertz-McGrath is requesting 10/30/2014 Sentencing hearing be rescheduled due to conflict w/ the DE's work.  State does not object.  Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 12/9/2014 at 2pm.  NTBS by the Court.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. had been out of state re family issues and was unable to go over PSI with Atty Hertz-McGrath.  Sentencing reset for 10/30/14 at 3:30.  Bond continued.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  12pm-  DE withdraws Franks-Mann motion.  State withdraws motion for leave to file information.  State dismisses school enhancer on count 1.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Denise Hertz-McGrath. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-10-14 @ 1:30pm. Bond continued.
